 The variable takes a value of 0 in the year GI is registered and is negative (positive) in the years before (after) GI registration. For state products that do not receive a GI in our sample, it takes a value of 0 for all years. The coefﬁcient on GI remains positive and signiﬁcant, albeit with a reduced magnitude. The coefﬁcient on GI implies that state products receiving GI experienced, on average, an increase in exports by 67.6%.7 Finally, we test for the robust- ness of our results to alternative speciﬁcations in long differ- ences. We include the initial value of exports as a control variable to capture the cross-sectional differences in exports across state products at the start of the sample. The coefﬁ- cient is positive and signiﬁcant with a larger magnitude com- pared to column 3. Taken together, these results imply that GIs do lead to a signiﬁcant increase in agricultural exports. Table 3 Total exports (lakhs INR) from India for different HS2 product lines over the years. HS2 2004 2005 2006 2007 2008 2009 2010 2011 2012 2013 2014 2015 2016 Average 1 1930 2608 221 3876 5515 7509 2470 782 675 952 733 395 38071 5364 2 188058 272947 328069 369082 533281 616443 890718 1405890 1786978 2721058 3018435 2759979 2703276 1353401 3 590093 629045 702693 526939 595508 692843 966950 1576187 1802322 2943383 3207030 2934040 3685351 1604030 4 72865 108471 77986 135789 151876 87273 107937 97364 211746 415358 225386 209446 192893 161107 5 16864 17738 17152 20746 18699 31603 47858 91010 60962 77950 60788 60214 53504 44238 6 22283 30136 28674 30564 36873 29013 29292 36366 42304 45460 46018 48176 54619 36906 7 167331 247956 270794 230546 328106 361115 367619 402439 493819 666579 647023 735650 781781 438520 8 340028 375790 395927 368667 493800 513131 508701 707368 747759 955060 973536 993401 1131060 654171 9 363565 393319 532169 603035 757011 749024 964376 1369673 1405937 1626407 1723573 1891920 2118213 1115248 10 887395 713055 754031 1407459 1419913 1351391 1480125 2947876 5072786 6075074 5625927 3896739 3890028 2732446 11 18082 12741 15883 22109 24582 29315 41593 71345 121072 171599 182315 188342 142031 80077 12 173349 182588 237431 343471 389128 329935 509126 941621 918995 998833 1330518 1081236 1205755 664768 13 147093 175458 174071 164581 206880 179600 377345 1767418 2341854 1424630 1181577 561234 560502 712480 14 10557 9878 11196 14211 13748 23573 33556 24508 31945 35430 36527 40736 45180 25465 15 152086 123831 146234 202313 261660 256886 307660 507613 521090 515971 594166 568595 596881 365768 Source: Author’s calculation based on the export data from DGCIS. 7 We calculate implied percentage change in exports as 100 £ (eb1  1). 358 M. Bansal, R. Singh Table 4 State-wise total agricultural exports (lakhs INR) across years.
